intro: Packera candidissima, commonly known as the white ragwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
